qas.question: Which decade in history was officially called the "Decade of the Brain"?

context: In the second half of the 20th century, developments in chemistry, electron microscopy, genetics, computer science, functional brain imaging, and other fields progressively opened new windows into brain structure and function. In the United States, <a0_0>the 1990s<a0_0/> were officially designated as the "Decade of the Brain" to commemorate advances made in brain research, and to promote funding for such research.
